snippet.title: T-Mobile catching up to AT&T, Verizon in customer satisfaction
snippet.description: The bottom line for carriers is that they have to resolve customer service inquiries on the first call or they're going to take a customer satisfaction hit.

snippet.title: Samsung vs. Apple: The J.D. Power satisfaction shakeup
snippet.description: While the iPad lost out by a slim margin in overall satisfaction, it still proved strongest in areas ranging from performance to design. So who's the real winner?

snippet.title: Apple, Samsung top J.D. Power satisfaction survey
snippet.description: Users of the nation's two top wireless services favor Apple, but those who use Sprint and T-Mobile love Samsung, according to a J.D. Power survey.

snippet.title: Comb-shaped business card plays the Stones
snippet.description: MODhair, a rock 'n' roll-themed hair salon in Rome, gets a groovy, music business card that plays rock when you run your nail across the teeth.

snippet.title: iPad tops in satisfaction among tablet owners
snippet.description: For the second year in a row, Apple ranks the highest among tablet makers for customer satisfaction, according to a J.D. Power survey.

snippet.title: Yahoo to live-stream Rolling Stones concert for $40 a pop
snippet.description: The upcoming live anniversary concert will be streamed through Yahoo Music to fans willing to shell out $40 for a virtual ticket.

snippet.title: Samsung Galaxy S3 tops iPhone in smartphone satisfaction poll
snippet.description: Two of Samsung's Galaxy smartphones scored higher grades than the three current iPhone models in a survey from the American Customer Satisfaction Index.

snippet.title: The iPhone tops J.D. Power satisfaction rankings -- again
snippet.description: It's the ninth consecutive time that Apple's iPhone has led all other smartphones in customer satisfaction. Samsung wasn't No. 2, but it was close.

snippet.title: Amazon tops Netflix in customer satisfaction survey
snippet.description: The American Customer Satisfaction Index says approval of e-commerce sites is up, with Amazon leading the pack and Netflix trailing behind.

snippet.title: iPhone 5 rated 5th in U.S. user satisfaction
snippet.description: Apple was No. 1 overall for user satisfaction, but the iPhone 5 came in behind four Android devices among U.S. consumers, says a poll from OnDevice Research.
